details.title: England Playing XI
details.content: L Winfield, T Beaumont, S Taylor, H Knight, N Sciver, F Wilson, K Brunt, J Gunn, A Shrubsole, L Marsh, A Hartley

details.title: India Playing XI
details.content: P Raut, S Mandhana, M Raj, H Kaur, D Sharma, V Krishnamurthy, S Pandey, S Verma, J Goswami, R Gayakwad, P Yadav
As the national anthem goes on, billions of Indian fans will be hoping for the women in blue to lift their maiden world cup.
With a jam-packed stadium, one can expect an action-packed final at the historic Lord's cricket ground.

details.title: VVS Laxman tweets
details.content:
Wishing lots of luck to each and every member of the @BCCIWomen team👍Enjoy the occasion😊 #WWC17Final pic.twitter.com/TckUkbJjlu

— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) July 23, 2017

details.title: Viru tweets
details.content:
Wishing our girls with an indomitable spirit , all the very best for today's final.
Lords Par Kabza !
GARV HAI ! #ChakDeIndia

— Virender Sehwag (@virendersehwag) July 23, 2017
Indian players go in for a hurdle as the England openers walk out to bat.
J Goswami opens the attack for India and starts off with a dot ball.

details.title: Over 1 - ENG 1/0
details.content: England get off the mark. Just one run from the first over. A good and steady start for India.
First boundary of the match comes off Tammy Beaumont for England!

details.title: First boundary of the final
details.content: First boundary of the match comes off Tammy Beaumont for England!

details.title: Rohit Sharma tweets
details.content:
The whole nation is behind and rooting for you #TeamIndia . It's a special day so enjoy every moment 😬@BCCIWomen #WWC17Final

— Rohit Sharma (@ImRo45) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 2 - ENG 11/0
details.content: An expensive over for India as 10 runs come off it! The hosts are picking up the pace!

details.title: Over 3 - ENG 15/0
details.content: One boundary off that over. England are scoring at five per over now.
Good fielding from Deepti Sharma! Definitely saved two runs at least!

details.title: Over 4 - ENG 17/0
details.content: After an expensive first over, Pandey comes back with a brilliant second one with just two runs coming off it.

details.title: Nothing gets past Deepti Sharma in the field!
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Mohammad Kaif tweets
details.content:
A historic day begins ! More than a billion people cheering for these spirited girls.
Come on India !#WWC17Final

— Mohammad Kaif (@MohammadKaif) July 23, 2017
India look to put pressure on the hosts with some quality fielding. Smriti Mandhana this time.

details.title: Stuart Broad tweets
details.content:
Best of luck to @englandcricket in the #WWCFinal2017 should be a great game! 🏆

— Stuart Broad (@StuartBroad8) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 5 - ENG 21/0
details.content: Goswami keeps up the good work for India. Just nine runs coming off her first three runs.
Two consecutive boundaries for England! Tammy Beaumont seems to be in good touch.

details.title: It's 400 for Tammy Beaumont!
details.content: English opener becomes the second batswoman to cross 400- run mark in this edition of the tournament.

details.title: Over 6 - ENG 30/0
details.content: A good come back by Pandey to end the over with just one run off the last four balls.

details.title: Tammy Beaumont is now the leading run getter of the tournament
details.content: via GIPHY
Laura Winfield catching up now, a boundary off the first ball of the eighth over.

details.title: Bowling change
details.content: Mithali brings Rajeshwari Gayakwad into the attack

details.title: Winfield sweeps it clean
Over 8 - ENG 42/0
details.content: The bowling change not turning out to be the best for India.
A huge shout from Goswami for LBW but no reaction from the umpire.

details.title: REVIEW
details.content: Goswami's delivery hits the pads of Winfield again and the umpire's finger goes up! India celebrate! But wait, England have asked for a review!

details.title: NOT OUT
details.content: Hawk eye shows the ball missing the stumps! The review saves Laura Winfield!

details.title: Indian fans right now
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 9 - ENG 43/0
details.content: A brilliant over from Goswami again, almost a wicket there!
A good start for England but India are keeping up the pressure.

details.title: Micheal Vaughan tweets
details.content:
Huge day for Cricket today ... Sold out World Cup final at Lords ... Good luck @englandcricket ... #WWC17 #goboldly

— Michael Vaughan (@MichaelVaughan) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 10 - ENG 43/0
details.content: Rajeshwari Gayakwad comes up with a good over with no run coming off it. India are not letting England break free.
Mithali Raj's bowlers better come up with a breakthrough before the English women convert their scores into a big one.

details.title: Bowling change
details.content: Can Deepti Sharma turn things up? (Photo | Cricbuzz)

details.title: Over 11 - ENG 46/0
details.content: Spin at both ends now as Deepti Sharma starts off with decent over, gives away three runs.

details.title: WICKET Laura Winfield 24
details.content: Gayakwad strikes as India get their first wicket! A brilliant off-break from Gayakwad manages to kiss the bail. Winfield departs for a decent 24.
The dangerous Sarah Taylor makes her way into the middle now.

details.title: First wicket of the final!
details.content: Winfield is gone. Gayakwad strikes.

details.title: Over 12 - ENG 50/1
details.content: Fifty comes up for England. India would love to get another wicket.

details.title: Sarah Taylor is in the middle now

details.content: The slowers bowlers are slowing it down for India. Tight lines and lengths from Deepti Sharma and Rajeshwari Gayakwad.

details.title: Master Blaster tweets
details.content:
Wishing our #WomenInBlue all the best for the #WWC17Final! We are all cheering for you! Messages of support from my 100MB family! #ENGvIND pic.twitter.com/i7BIWEx1W3

— sachin tendulkar (@sachin_rt) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 13 - ENG 52/1
details.content: Two runs off the over. Sarah Taylor is looking for a steady start.

details.title: You are not getting a boundary that easy Sarah
details.content: via GIPHY
A brilliant dive to save a certain boundary! Indian fielders are lively out there!

details.title: Over 14 - ENG 59/1
details.content: Tammy Beaumont looks undeterred after the fall of Winfield, taking her chances to score boundaries.

details.title: WICKET  Tammy Beaumont 23
details.content: And Beaumont departs! A brilliant catch by Goswami off Poonam Yadav, who strikes in her very first over.
Skipper Heather Knight joins Sarah Taylor in the middle.

details.title: Want a wicket ? Call me maybe!
details.content: Three balls into the attack and Poonam Yadav strikes !  (Photo |Cricket Flips)

details.title: Heather Knight
details.content: England need a special innings from their skipper.

details.title: Over 15 - ENG 61/2
details.content: With two breakthroughs, India are on top now. But, if anyone can help England recover from this, it is reliable skipper, Heather Knight and the aggressive Sarah Taylor.

details.title: Beaumont@ 410
details.content: Congrats Tammy Beaumont - leading run getter of ICC Women's World Cup 2017 (AP)

details.title: Over 16 - ENG 63/2
details.content: Just one run off that Deepti Sharma over. Taylor and Knight are playing it safe.

details.title: DRINKS BREAK - ENG 63/2 (Sarah Taylor 10*, Heather Knight 1*)
details.content: India have the sight advantage but England are picking up slow and steady.

details.title: Ravindra Jadeja tweets
details.content:
Poonam Yadav Strikes. 2nd Wicket Gone. 8 More To Go. 💪🏾🇮🇳#England - 60/2 14.3 Overs#IndvsEng #INDvENG #WWC17 #WWC17Final

— Sir Ravindra Jadeja (@SirJadeja) July 23, 2017

details.title: REVIEW
details.content: An LBW appeal from Poonam Yadav! And Mithali Raj agrees to go for a review!

details.title: Successful review for the Women in Blue
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: WICKET Heather Knight 1
details.content: Brilliant bowling from Poonam Yadav! Two wickets in two overs for her! Hawk eye shows the ball hitting the stumps!
Natalie Sciver is the new batswoman in for England. Heather Knight is a big big wicket for India!

details.title: Over 17 - ENG 64/3
details.content: England are three down now and the pressure is on for Taylor and Sciver!

details.title: New  woman in
details.content: Natalie Sciver has already scored two tons in the tournament (Photo | facebook/Women's Cricket World)
A welcome boundary for England! Sciver tries to break free with a straight drive down the ground.

details.title: Over 18 - ENG 69/3
details.content: Sciver and Taylor will want to keep the scoreboard ticking and build a steady partnership for England.

details.title: R Ashwin tweets it all
details.content:
Sweep!!!Counter sweep👏 #ENGvIND

— Ashwin Ravichandran (@ashwinravi99) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 19 - ENG 74/3
details.content: Indian bowlers continue to keep it tight, despite the occassional boundary.
The stands in Lord's is almost full now! A brilliant crowd have turned up, and it is not just to support the hosts!

details.title: Home of cricket is busy
details.content: Lord's is full of enthusiastic spectators cheering for both sides (Photo | Twitter/Cricket World Cup)
It's a direct hit and there's an appeal for run out as Sarah Taylor scampers to one end! A third umpire review shows she's safe!

details.title: Over 20 - ENG 80/3
details.content: England's plan now seems to be scoring with quick runs between the wickets to keep the scoring up.

details.title: Meanwhile the Indian supporters
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 21 - ENG 85/3
details.content: Both batswomen are trying to negotiate Poonam and Gayakwad's troubling spin bowling.

details.title: Joe Root tweets
details.content:
Great start for @englandcricket at lords! Full house, suns out! Great day to make history! #comeonengland #WWC17

— Joe Root (@root66) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 22 - ENG 88/3
details.content: England's run rate is 3.8 per over. India are really tightening it up.

details.title: Over 23 - ENG 91/3
details.content: England are inching towards hundred. Can India get another wicket before they reach the landmark?

details.title: Solidarity from Hyderabad
details.content: Hundreds of youths participated in a Roadshow with the theme “Cracking kudos to Cricketing SHEroes” at I Max Circle, Necklace Road in Hyderabad. (EPS | Sayantan Ghosh)

details.title: Over 24 - ENG 94/3
details.content: Clouds look ominous above Lord's. Fans and players would be praying that there are no showers.
A boundary for Sciver! Harmanpreet Kaur allows her to open up.

details.title: I got run out in semi-final, and I am not going that way again : Sarah Taylor
details.content: via GIPHY
A steady drizzle now. Ground staff are keeping the covers ready.

details.title: 100 up in 24.3 overs
Over 25 - 103/3
details.content: Sciver and Taylor are grinding the bowling.
The rain is pouring now and the ground staff don't look happy.

details.title: Over 26 - ENG 107/3
details.content: Despite heavy downpour, play continues at Lord's.

details.title: At least the batswomen have helmets
details.content: via GIPHY
Mithali Raj brings back seam to look for a breakthrough.

details.title: You Pundit
details.content:
This partnership looks dangerous but loved the way Sarah Taylor enjoying the batting with all smiles #WWC17Final #INDvENG

— Yoga Raj (@YogaMSDian) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 27 - ENG 114/3
details.content: Taylor and Sciver are building a very useful partnership for the hosts.

details.title: 50-runs between NR Sciver 29 (40) and SJ Taylor 31 (43)

details.content: An appeal from Deepti Sharma for LBW, but only a shake of the head from the umpire.

Wouldn't be a bad idea to bring in Jhulan & Pandey to bowl a couple each from one end with spinners at the other. #IndvEng #WWC17final

— Richard Anderson (@RichardInd1978) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 28 - ENG 118/3
details.content: Would be a good idea to attack with pace from both ends for India?
Skipper Mithali Raj has lots to think about as the two English batswoman milk runs off the Indian bowlers.

details.title: Over 29 - ENG 128/3
details.content: India are desperate for a wicket. Taylor and Sciver look solid and if they get going, the women in blue will be in big trouble.
The English team in the dressing room are smiling, completely at ease with the wonderful partnership that is flourishing.

details.title: Sharma VS Taylor is worth a watch
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 30 - ENG 133/3
details.content: Mithali would want to bring back her wicket-taking bowlers right about now.

details.title: Goswami back into  the attack
details.content: (AP)
Chipped in the air by Sarah Taylor and the bowler couldn't get to it! Desperation for India!

details.title: Over 31 - ENG 140/3
details.content: A chance missed for India. How much is Sarah Taylor going to make Goswami pay?

details.title: President of India tweets
details.content:
All the very best to the Women in Blue for today's #WWC17Final. Come on India 🇮🇳#IndvsEng

— Ram Nath Kovind (@RamNathKoviind) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 32 - ENG 144/3
details.content: Rain has disappeared for good now. Is there a silver lining among the clouds for India?

details.title: WICKET Sarah Taylor 45
details.content: Goswami makes sure to get her this time! Sarah Taylor departs five runs away from a half century.

details.title: Taylor is gone and Indian dugout is like:
details.content: via GIPHY
Finally!! Mithali Raj can breathe a little easy with the fall of the dangerous Taylor.

details.title: WICKET Fran Wilson 0
details.content: TWO IN TWO for Jhulan Goswami!! Take a bow! New batswoman in Fran Wilson walks off with a golden Duck!

details.title: Sarah Taylor is third leading rungetter of the tournament
details.content: Sarah Taylor has made a total of 396 runs from 9 innings. (AP)
Goswami on a hat-trick.

details.title: Best bowler for a reason
details.content: J Goswami (7.0 - 2 - 18 - 2) (AP)

details.title: Over 33 - ENG 146/5
details.content: Bringing back Jhulan Goswami works for India! Brilliant bowling! Natalie Sciver has a lot of responsibility on her shoulders now.

Ishant Sharma in CT13 final striked twice and now his Hair alike, Action alike Jhulan in #WWC17Final England Common side.

— Himan Jadduboy (@HimanJadduboy) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 34 - ENG 151/5
details.content: England reach 150 with 16 overs left. The current run rate is 4.49.
India miss out on a golden run out oppurtunity! Man, that was close!

details.title: Over 35 - ENG 155/5
details.content: India cannot afford to miss chances in a final. Can England make them pay for their mistakes?
Indian pacers have been really tight with their lines and lengths today.

details.title: Over 36 - ENG 157/5
details.content: Goswami keeps up her good work. With just two overs left in her spell, will Mithali save her for the end or will she keep her on to get more wickets?
Change of ends for pacer Shikha Pandey.

details.title: Natalie Sciver  50* (66) 5 X 4, 0 X 6

details.content:
Great match so far, India needs to take wickets though and keep the score under 220. #WWC17Final #WWC17 #WomenInBlue

— A.T. (@AyushiThakur06) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 37 - ENG 164/5
details.content: Natalie Sciver is trying to put the pressure back on the Indian bowlers. A boundary off the last ball of this over cheers her up.

details.title: REVIEW
details.content: It's Goswami again! She gets it right on the pads and the finger goes up! Natalie Sciver takes her chance with a review!

details.title: Third wicket for Jhulan!
details.content: Natalie Sciver walks back into the pavilion aften an unsuccessful appeal (AP)

details.title: WICKET Natalie Sciver 51
details.content: Hawk eye shows the ball hitting the middle stump! Jhulan Goswami is India's hero today! England's biggest hope walks off after a well made half century.

details.title: Well played Natalie Sciver
details.content: via GIPHY
Two new batters at the crease now with Katherine Brunt and Jenny Gunn.

details.title: Over 38 - ENG 164/6
details.content: Mithali did a great job of bringing back and having faith in her star bowler, Goswami. England are struggling.

details.title: Over 39 - ENG 169/6
details.content: Just one run from this over. Rajeshwari Gayakwad keeps it tight to complement Goswami.
Jhulan Goswami into her final over now.
At the current run rate, England are predicted to score around 210.

details.title: Over 40 - ENG 168/6
details.content: This is one world cup final that Jhulan Goswami would never forget. A brilliant display by the experienced pacer. She finishes with figures of 3/23 with three maidens from 10 overs.

details.title: Over 41 - ENG 171/6
details.content: Katherine Brunt and Jenny Gunn should look to attack. Dot balls will cost England.

The spinners are India's lifeline. Good signs.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) July 23, 2017
Brunt scoops it up, but the ball lands just short of a diving Smriti Mandhana!

details.title: Over 42 - ENG 174/6
details.content: England need at least 200 to really challenge India. Chants of "India! India!" echoes at Lord's.
A shy at the stumps and it's close! There's been an overthrow too! A dive saves Brunt in the end!

details.title: Over 43 - ENG 179/6
details.content: India would be happy with anything less than 200 as target.

details.title: Over 44 - ENG 188/6
details.content: A good shot for four from Katherine Brunt in this over. England will need more of these.

details.title: What a spell
details.content: Jhulan Goswami finishes seventh among wicket takers of the tournament with 10 wickets (AP)

details.title: Over 45 - ENG 192/6
details.content: The English batswomen are inching towards 200. India would love to get a wicket now.

details.title: WICKET Katherine Brunt 34
details.content: A direct hit at the stumps by Deepti Sharma catches a rushing Katherine Brunt short of the crease! She had no chance! India got the breakthrough they needed.

details.title: Deepti Sharma is too sharp!
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 46 - ENG 196/7
details.content: England have scored a decent 25 runs off the last five overs. But, Brunt's wicket means a new batter at the crease.

details.title: Over 47 - ENG 201/7
details.content: Two hundred is up for England! The crowd erupt with cheers for the home side!
Laura Marsh is the next woman in for England.
No ball from Shikha Pandey! Unfortunate for India! A free-hit for Jenny Gunn.

details.title: #BackingBlue

details.content: The free-hit costs India only one run. Relief for Pandey.

details.title: Over 48 - ENG 215/7
details.content: With the long boundaries at Lord's and a slow pitch, any score that England end up with will be a tough chase for India.

details.title: Yep
Over 49 - ENG 221/7
details.content: The last over is up next. England have pulled it together despite the loss of a flurry of wickets.
Quality fielding by India! Shikha Pandey, who has not had the best of days with her bowling saves at least two runs.

details.title: Over 50 - ENG 228/7
details.content: Deepti Sharma gives away just seven runs in the last over! The 19-year-old off-spinner has done brilliantly today. However, England will be rather happy with this total.

details.title: What a last over from Deepti Sharma
details.content: Just seven runs conceded; Brilliant spell from the teenager (AP)

details.title: Jhulan Goswami - 3/23 (10 overs)
details.content: "There's hardly any bounce in the wicket so I tried to keep the ball in the right areas. I went back to the basics and that proved to work out very well today," says Goswami after her wonderful performance today.

details.title: Innings Break - ENG 228/7
details.content: India need to chase down 228 in their 50 overs to make a mark in history. If any one of their top batswoman gets a good score, then India will have no problems chasing. However, England's bowlers will not make it easy.

229 to win. Can India chase it down?#ENGvIND #WWC17 pic.twitter.com/7MhB3xCNlt

— Cricket World Cup (@cricketworldcup) July 23, 2017
Smriti Mandhana and Punam Raut open the innings for India.
India off the mark with a single.
The Indian fans will surely hope Smriti Mandhana fires today.

details.title: WICKET
details.content: England strikes early... Smriti Mandhana poor run continues...She is out for a duck...
https://twitter.com/cricketworldcup/status/889115117065035776

details.title: Over 2 - IND 7/1
details.content: Two overs gone. Seven for one wicket. India needs to get back into the game.

details.title: Over 3 - IND 8/1
details.content: India off to a slow start. Hope they pile on runs at a quicker rate.
Raut scores the first boundary for the Blue Brigade.

details.content:
India's highest score batting 2nd in ENG is 230 during a victorious chase the last time they played at Lord's in 2012 #WWC17

details.title: Over 4 - IND 13/1
details.content: India are at 13 for the loss of one wicket at the end of fourth over.
The English pacers are definitely tring their best to get their second breakthrough.

details.title: Don't worry, I got this!
Over 5 - IND 18/1
details.content: Mithali Raj ends a brilliant over with a boundary.
Into her third over, Anya Shrubsole isn't giving any room for the Indians to score runs.

India's highest score batting 2nd in ENG is 230 during a victorious chase the last time they played at Lord's in 2012 #WWC17

— hypocaust (@_hypocaust) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 6 - IND 20/1
details.content: Six overs gone...A great over from Anya Shrubsole..Just two runs off it...
Indian skipper Mithali scores a boundary off Brunt.
The English fans are definitely not happy.

details.title: Because Mithali Raj is in the crease...

details.title: Over 7 - IND 24/1
details.content: Just a boundary off the over. India at 24 for the loss of one wicket in seven overs.

details.title: A dream come true for Anya Shrubsole
details.content:
16 years later - she takes a wicket in her first over at the #WWC17 Final! #ENGvIND https://t.co/iNDUdH9ax5

And its a SIXXXXXXXXXXXX.........Punam Raut on fire. One can surely expect her to score more of those.

India's highest score batting 2nd in ENG is 230 during a victorious chase the last time they played at Lord's in 2012 #WWC17

— hypocaust (@_hypocaust) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 8 - IND 31/1
details.content: Punam Raut and Mithali Raj are playing the waiting game here. Not giving any room for errors.
Natalie Sciver is bought into the attack for the ninth over. England are desperate for a wicket.
Raut is on 17 from 32 balls. She needs to score quick. A lot of dot balls aren't good.
Raut hits a beautiful four over mid wicket. She needs to score those fours and pretty quick as well.

details.title: What a cracking shot from Poonam Raut!

details.content: Just as I was saying, she scores another!

details.title: Over 11 - IND 41/1
details.content: India are definitely back on track thanks to Raut's timely boundaries.
The girls need to rotate the strike and keep the scoreboard moving.

details.title: Sanjay Manjarekar reminds
details.content:
That's women's cricket coming of age...remember the date : 23rd July 2017.#WWC17Final #Lords pic.twitter.com/VoBmreS2o1

— Sanjay Manjrekar (@sanjaymanjrekar) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 12 - IND 43/1
details.content: Chasing a target of 229. The girls need to target the English bowlers.
Indian skipper Mithali Raj departs, a run out. Definitely the Indian fans must be disappointed.

details.title: Mithali Raj dismissed; England fans be like
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 13 - IND 43/1
details.content: Harmanpreet Kaur in the middle. Need to play a similar knock like the one against the Aussies in the semis. A wicket and maiden.

details.title: Mithali @ 409
details.content: The Indian skipper fell just one run below England's Tammy Baeumont as the tournament topscorer (AP)
Raut and Kaur need to build a partnership here if they have to chase down 228.

details.title: Over 14 - IND 45/2
details.content: Kaur scores her first run after eight dot balls.

Wouldn't have helped if she had dived. She wasn't going to make it. Maybe she didn't believe there was one.....

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) July 23, 2017
Kaur scores a much needed boundary. A glims of what she is capable of doing.

details.title: Over 15 - IND 50/2
details.content: Marsh appeals for a LBW. Umpire turns down.
With the last five overs yielding just 19 runs, the Blue Brigade needs to fire soon. The required runrate is rising well over five.

details.title: Over 16 - IND 50/2
details.content: 50 runs on board.

details.title: Fifty up for India eves in 15 overs
Over 17 - IND 54/2
details.content: India must convert their ones into twos.

details.title: Need to speed-up now, India going too slow

details.content: India need to step up their game if they want to lift their maiden World Cup. With last five overs yielding just 11 runs, the girls have to ensure quick runs.

details.title: Bowling change
details.content: Alex Harley to test the Indian defense
India's current rate - 3.17 Required rate - 5.05

details.content: Harmanpreet Kaur smashes a HUGE SIXXXXXXXXXX....

details.title: Harmanpreet sends the ball flying!
Over 21 - IND 73/2
details.content: The Indian women slowly but steadily piling on runs.
Harmanpreet Kaur has scored a total of 327 runs so far in the tournament, while Punam Raut has scored 328.

229 to win the World Cup !#WWC17Final

details.title: Over 22 - IND 75/2
details.content: Harmanpreet Kaur and Punam Raut are rotating the strike. Which is the need of the hour.

details.title: Did you know?
details.content:
England's Eileen Ash, at the age of 105, is the oldest surviving woman cricketer.

Here she is. 105 not out, & wearing her England blazer from 1937. The green rose is the symbol of the Women's Cricket Association. #WWC17 pic.twitter.com/iM2CcIdVzb

— Raf Nicholson (@RafNicholson) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 23 - IND 79/2
details.content: Lesser dot balls, definitely a confidence booster for the girls.
India require 150 runs to win the World Cup. Fingers crossed.

details.title: Will the run-a-ball strategy help India to steady their chase ?
details.content: Punam Raut has a big role to play in this chase (AP)
Kaur you beauty. Another SIXXXXXXXX.

details.title: Over 24 - IND 88/2
details.content: A great over for India. Nine runs coming off it.

details.title: Another one!
details.content: Harmanpreet Kaur hits her second six of the innings.

details.title: Over 25 - IND 91/2
details.content: A tidy over from England. Just three from it.
As India near 100, Raut and Kaur edge to a 50-run stand between them.
Natalie Sciver is phenomenal tonight; as sharp as one can get in the field.
Its a NO BALL....
50 partnership up...Great efforts from both Harmanpreet Kaur and Punam Raut...

details.title: 50 runs Punam Raut and Harmanpreet Kaur
Over 26 - IND 99/2
details.content: India inches towards 100.
100 up for India. Thanks to Kaur and Raut.

details.title: Over 27 - IND 106/2
details.content: The Blue Brigade are on the right track. They need to continue their good show.

details.title: Over 28 - IND 108/2
details.content: Raut and Kaur, both in their 40's. Exactly what the team required. Two settled batswomen at the center.

details.title: Micheal Vaughan tweets
details.content:
Officially Worried .... Come on @englandcricket .. !!!!!! #WWCFinal

— Michael Vaughan (@MichaelVaughan) July 23, 2017

details.title: Chak De India !
details.content: (Twitter/Cricket World Cup)
A four off Kaur's bat. The English women are looking frustrated.

details.title: Over 29 - IND 114/2
details.content: Six runs from Natalie Sciver's over. Both Raut and Kaur marching towards 50.

details.title: Over 30 - IND 120/2
details.content: Well played Raut. Reaches magical 50 run mark.

details.title: Neutral fans be like
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Half century for Punam Raut
details.content: Sensible innings from the opener. 53 of 77. 2X4, 1X6

details.title: Alex Blackwell tweets
details.content:
Well played Raut for her half century at #lords #WWC17final. Love how she can play with such control & bat through the gears @BCCIWomen @ICC

— Alex Blackwell (@AlexBlackwell2) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 31 - IND 127/2
details.content: Running between the wickets has been incredibly good by Punam Raut and Harmanpreet Kaur. England desperately need a breakthrough.

This partnership is exactly what India needed. Harmanpreet is just coasting for now. Holds the key

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) July 23, 2017
Good placement from Raut. India are motoring on now.

details.title: Over 32 - IND 133/2
details.content: India are now just 97 runs away from lifting their first world cup. Can Raut and Kaur guide them through?
The partnership enter 90s
Katherine Brunt is trying all kinds of different variations. Will she get the breakthrough England need?

details.title: Harmanpreet !!
Over 33 - IND 136/2
details.content: A good over for England. Brunt keeps it nice and tight.

details.title: Harsha Bhogle tweets
details.content:
Composed from Harmanpreet. There's a lot more in the tank. Just needs to keep going like this. No urgency

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) July 23, 2017

details.title: Alex Hartley dismisses Punam Raut to bring England back into the game
WICKET Harmanpreet Kaur 51
details.content: Alex Hartley strikes for England! A simple catch for Beaumont. Kaur departs after a well made 51. Did she just throw it away after reaching her half century?

details.title: Boundary from V Krishnamurthy to relieve the pressure of India
WICKET Harmanpreet Kaur 51
details.content: Alex Hartley strikes for England! A simple catch for Beaumont. Kaur departs after a well made 51. Did she just throw it away after reaching her half century?

details.title: Over 34 - IND 138/3
details.content: Just what England wanted. A wicket and just two runs coming off the 34th over. England needs to capatalize on the situation.

details.title: Boundary by V Krishnamurthy to relieve some pressure on India
Over 35 - IND 145/3
details.content: India still in a commanding position. Seven runs off it.
Raining boundaries for India now! The tide slowly turning towards the Blue Brigade.

details.title: Over 36 - IND 155/3
details.content: India are looking to accelerate. Raut is in great touch for sure.

details.title: Another one! Punam continues her sublime show with the bat
Over 37 - IND 161/3
details.content: India require 78 off 78 balls. It's still anyone's game though.
Skipper Heather Knight drops the crucial catch of Raut! Did she just drop the world cup too?

details.title: Brace yourselves cricket fans; this is gonna be close
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 38 - IND 165/3
details.content: A cheeky single off the last ball. England are trying to keep it tight and pull things back.

details.title: Over 39 - IND 166/3
details.content: Just one run off that Laura Marsh over. The boundaries are slowly drying up for India.
Punam Raut is down with cramps and receives treatment from the physio. Worrying for India.

details.title: Over 40 - IND 173/3
details.content: Raut is inching towards a world cup hundred, but she still seems to be struggling with her cramps.

details.title: When a loose shot lands in no-woman's land ...
details.content: via GIPHY

A crucial big innings here from Punam Raut - watch the highlights of her half-century! #ENGvIND #WWC17

WATCH: https://t.co/rQnO7YBPhJ pic.twitter.com/25EoVz5KeT

— Cricket World Cup (@cricketworldcup) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 41 - IND 177/3
details.content: Marsh wraps up her ten overs leaking 40 runs and going wicketless.

details.title: Over 42 - IND 182/3
details.content: 47 required from 48 balls for India. It's going to be a nail-biter!

details.title: Manoj Tiwari tweets
details.content:
@BCCIWomen inching towards target. Need calm and patience. #EngvInd #WWC17Final

— Manoj Tiwari (@cricwhoop) July 23, 2017
FOUR off consecutive balls! A great start to the over! The Indian dugout are jumping up in happiness!

details.title: Another 50 run stand for India
WICKET Punam Raut 86
details.content: A huge blow for India! Raut departs after a brilliant 86! It is really anyone's game right now!

details.title: Over 43 - IND 191/4
details.content: England are right back in the game! Anya Shrubsole's breakthrough will surely fire up the English women!

details.title: Dismissing Raut, Shrubsole be like
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Sushma gone for duck
WICKET Sushma Verma 0
details.content: Another wicket down! It's like a repeat of what happened in the England innings! Tension on everyone's face!
Deepti Sharma is the new batswoman in.
Pressure pressure pressure! Deepti Sharma just manages to get back into the crease as the keeper knocks down the stumps!

details.title: Why should the ball always land where nobody is placed !!
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 44 - IND 198/5
details.content: It's all up to Veda Krishnamurthy now for India.

details.title: Krishnamurthy departs
details.content: England is definitely back in the game now

details.title: WICKET Veda Krishnamurthy 35
details.content: Veda Krishnamurthy departs as she hits one in the air to be caught out! That was the last thing India needed! 200 is up for the Blue Brigade meanwhile.

details.title: Sachin Tendulkar tweets
details.content:
Come on India! We are just 3 hits away from cracking it. We have 7 overs left. #IndvsEng #WWC17Final

— sachin tendulkar (@sachin_rt) July 23, 2017

details.title: WICKET Jhulan Goswami 0
details.content: Goswami's magic with the ball was not to be with the bat! Shrubsole strikes again!

details.title: Deepti reminds it isn't over yet

details.content: Deepti Sharma strikes one to the boundary for FOUR! Cheers from the crowd! This game is not over yet!

Need a couple of calm heads in the middle to take this home #WWC17Final #INDvENG

— Ashwin Mani (@ashwinmani) July 23, 2017

details.title: Over 46 - IND 208/7
details.content: Deepti Sharma seems sensible out there. Singles are what is needed for India.
Run run run! Can Deepti Sharma and Shikha Pandey get India through?
An appeal for stumping off a wide delivery! But, Deepti Sharma gets the benefit of the doubt from the third umpire! A close call for India.

details.title: What India is missing
Over 47 - IND 215/7
details.content: 13 runs required off 18 balls now for India, while England need three wickets. The next over is important.
Good running from India. Deepti Sharma and Shikha Pandey are sensible and calm out there.

details.title: WICKET Shikha Pandey 4
details.content: A commentator's curse? Unnecessary confusion in running costs Shikha Pandey!
Poonam Yadav is in next. Her job will be to get Deepti Sharma on strike.
10 off 13 required for India now.

details.title: Over 48 - IND 218/8
details.content: Deepti Sharma sends Poonam Yadav back on the last ball of the over. Sensible from the young woman.
England just win wicket away from kissing the cup

details.title: WICKET Deepti Sharma 14
details.content: It's a five-wicket haul for England's Anya Shrubsole! Deepti Sharma has to go! Absolute despeartion for India!

details.title: And the cup stays at home. Congrats England
England win the world Cup!
details.content: Jenny Gunn drops Poonam Yadav but Anya Shrubsole wraps it up, knocking out Rajeshwari Gayakwad's stumps! Shrubsole picks up six wickets in a world cup final! What a dream day for her and England!
What a game that was! Tough luck for India!
Fourth world cup title for England. Lord's has never seen a bigger crowd for a women's game and pretty sure every pound was worth it for the fans.

details.title: Woman of the match - Anya Shrubsole
details.content: No surprises for this award. Shrubsole gets the award for her brilliant spell, ending with figurs of 6/46, which literally won England the game.

details.title: Player of the tournament - Tammy Beaumont
details.content: The player of the tournament award goes to the highest run scorer. Beaumont has scored 410 runs in the tournament.
Huge cheer for Mithali Raj and India as the skipper walks up for an interview.

"Inexperience of playing in such a platform, in such a high pressure game I think perhaps cost us. But, we can be proud of ourselves. Everyone at home will now watch women cricket more, and that's a good thing for women's cricket," says Mithali Raj.
A brilliant match worthy of a final but Indian fans will be heartbroken. That's all from us here. Thank you for joining us.
